resources.string:
One Rep Max (1RM) is a vital metric in weight training, representing the maximum amount of weight an individual can lift for a single repetition with proper form. It's crucial for designing effective strength training programs.

Calculation Methods:

Epley Formula: Estimates 1RM using weight lifted and repetitions performed.
Brzycki Formula: Calculates 1RM based on weight lifted and repetitions.
Lombardi Formula: Provides an alternative approach to estimating 1RM using weight lifted and repetitions.
